p: Similarly, Qin and coworkers [ 16] exploited Big Data to predict the number of new COVID-19 cases, either suspected or confirmed. In more detail, authors utilized a lagged series of “Social media search indexes” (SMSI) for various keywords, including COVID-19 clinical symptoms (such as dry cough, fever, chest distress, and pneumonia). Authors found that, by employing techniques such as subset selection method, new COVID-19 suspected and confirmed cases could be detected 6–9 and 10 days in advance, respectively.
